hypothesis_content.title: Miner Revenue Stress Test for Bull Sustainability
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC miner revenue (7-day MA) drops >30% from monthly high during BULL regime, and hash ribbon (30-day hash rate MA crosses below 60-day) triggers, subsequent 15-day returns are negative with 80% probability, signaling failed breakout or bull exhaustion.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Miner capitulation during bull markets creates persistent selling pressure from forced liquidations. Hash ribbon confirms network stress. Price at highs with weakening fundamentals suggests exhaustion.
entry_conditions: BTC miner revenue (7-day MA) down >30% from 30-day high
Hash ribbon: 30-day hash rate MA < 60-day hash rate MA
Price within 5% of recent local high

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price drops 8% from entry OR miner revenue recovers >15%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price makes new high above entry +3%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean 15-day return not significantly negative (p > 0.05) OR success rate < 65% in backtest.
